text: Saschiz (; , Hungarian pronunciation: ; Transylvanian Saxon dialect: Kisd) is a commune in Mureș County, Transylvania, Romania. It has a population of 2,048: 88% Romanians, 5% Germans, 4% Hungarians and 3% Roma. It is composed of three villages: Cloașterf, Mihai Viteazu (Zoltan until 1932) and Saschiz. Saschiz, with its 15th-century church, is part of the World Heritage Site Villages with fortified churches in Transylvania, designated in 1999 by UNESCO. {| class="wikitable" |- ! In Romanian ! In German !
